page.title: 16STONERAISE PRIMARY SCHOOL(2)
page.content: The present headmaster,Mr,Sanderson, is retiring at the end of the 1985 summer term after 23 years as the Head of Stoneraise school.He told us that in its heyday there were 128 pupils in the school.In 1985 there are 75.He said that very few of the children who came to the school were from the farms.This is in contrast to a few years ago because nowadays farming is labour_intensive and fewer people work on the farms.Most of the children here come from Durdar Rd. on the outskirts of Carlisle.The Ribble Bus Company extend their local service twice a day to transport the children to and from the school.Over half the children are brought in cars.Mr.Sanderson has enjoyed being at the school.He thinks that education is more relaxed and informal nowadays and the curriculum is much broader.
